Description: Round-topped sandstone stela of Domitian with a winged solar disc and pendant uraei, traces of red paint surviving, with the Emperor as Pharaoh making offerings to the Buchis bull, the eleven horizontal registers of hieroglyphs record a great festival either to record the bull's installation or funerary rites.
Bibliographic references: Mond & Myers 1934 / The Bucheum (2:15-17, 33, 52, pl. XLIV)
